name: Dummy (xTeens Game Studios)
description:
Dummy is an  Arena FPS developed by xTeens Game Studios. Fight various unique enemies, customise your Dummy, manoeuvre around the arenas, beat the campaign and defeat your friends in the various gamemodes.

The Arena is a testing-ground for your tools:

  • Hammer: When swung, this creates a concussive blast around you, throwing you and all you enemies into the air, draining the energy from your opponents.
  • Assault Rifle: A precise, full-auto rifle that is effective in the hands of those with strong trigger discipline.
  • Shotgun: While called a shotgun, it's technically a railgun. But we don't care, all we know is it breaks stuff good.
  • Pistol: In a pinch? Whip out this ole reliable and spray bullets as fast as you can pull the trigger!
  • Grapple Gun: Shoulder mounted, meaning you don't have to stop destroying everything to zoom across the arena.
  • Friction Manipulation Boots: Due to the nature of the boots equipped to your Dummy, you have the ability  to slide to avoid gunfire and reach closed off areas.  

Singleplayer:

  • Test mode: Fight through 3 arenas, collecting your equipment as you go along, to then confront a boss at the end of it all.
  • Boss Rush: Fight all 4 of the bosses one after the other, a test of your ability to stay alive and utilise the sandbox.
  • Endless: Fight through endless waves of enemies until you die. With the occasional boss thrown into the mix. And by occasional, we mean very frequent.

Multiplayer (Coming Soon):

  • Equipment Test: A 6 player free-for-all gamemode - kill as many other Dummies as you can in the time limit.
  • Training Sequence: 3v3 deathmatch, but with chaos surgically added into the mix. Start with only your hammers and compete to control the large, open map, unlocking weapons for your team, and powerups for yourself.
  • Showdown: Had a disagreement with someone? Resolve it peacefully, and challenge them to a 1v1 match, each starting with all your equipment, and playing in a claustrophobic arena until one of you dies.

Specs, Controls, and Technical Issues:

Specs:

I suspect you could run it on lower end systems than this, I wasn't sure of the threshold below my Laptop of which this would be unplayable. I could hit 30FPS pretty consistently on my laptop.

MinimumRecommendedCPU: Ryzen 5 3500 (U), Intel Core i5-9400F
GPU: Radeon RX 480, Nvidia GeForce 1060
RAM: 4GB Available
Storage: 245 MBCPU:  Ryzen 7 2700 (U), Intel Core i7-8550U
GPU: Radeon RX 580, Nvidia GeForce 1650
RAM: 8GB Available
Storage: 245 MB

Controls:

  • [Space] - Jump
  • [Q] - Switch Weapons
  • [C] - Equip Pistol
  • [F] - Hammer
  • [LCTRL] - Slide/Crouch
  • [W][A][S][D] - Move
  • [Esc] - Pause
  • [LMB] - Fire
  • [RMB] - Zoom
  • [MMB] - Grappling Hook

Technical Issues:

Changing settings out of game - if for some reason you are unable to boot the game because of a setting, the settings are saved to PlayerPrefs. The location for your respective platforms are detailed on the Unity Documentation here.

Uninstalling - if you did not download through the app, it should be safe to simply delete all the files for the game. Otherwise, you can uninstall through the itch desktop app.

WINE - The game does not work through WINE as Unity is a C# based game engine, so it won't work.
